results.title: ABZÛ
results.brief_description: ABZÛ is an exploration game where you are a lone diver in a lush ocean world. The diver descends deeper and deeper into the depths, where she will encounter majestic creatures, discover ancient secrets, and search for her true purpose.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.title: Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché
results.brief_description: The epic life story of Alice Guy-Blaché (1873–1968), a French screenwriter, director and producer, true pioneer of cinema, the first person who made a narrative fiction film; author of hundreds of movies, but banished from history books.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

results.title_for_label: Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché
results.description: The epic life story of Alice Guy-Blaché (1873–1968), a French screenwriter, director and producer, true pioneer of cinema, the first person who made a narrative fiction film; author of hundreds of movies, but banished from history books. Ignored and forgotten. At last remembered.
description_for_label: The epic life story of Alice Guy-Blaché (1873–1968), a French screenwriter, director and producer, true pioneer of cinema, the first person who made a narrative fiction film; author of hundreds of movies, but banished from history books. Ignored and forgotten. At last remembered.

results.title: White Terror
results.creator_credit: Samir, Annette Pisacane, Matthieu Belghiti and Daniel Schweizer

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Samir, Annette Pisacane, Matthieu Belghiti and Daniel Schweizer

results.title: What Happened, Miss Simone?
results.creator_credit: Amy Hobby, Liz Garbus, Justin Wilkes, Rebecca Luke, Markus Kirschner and RadicalMedia
results.brief_description: The film chronicles Nina Simone’s journey from child piano prodigy to iconic musician and passionate activist, told in her own words.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Amy Hobby, Liz Garbus, Justin Wilkes, Rebecca Luke, Markus Kirschner and RadicalMedia
results.description: The film chronicles Nina Simone’s journey from child piano prodigy to iconic musician and passionate activist, told in her own words.

results.title: Welcome to Chechnya
results.creator_credit: Tyler H. Walk, HBO Documentary Films, Public Square Films, David France & Joy A. Tomchin Film, Ninety Thousand Words, Maylo Films, BBC Storyville, Alice Henty, David France and Askold Kurov
results.brief_description: This searing investigative work shadows a group of activists risking unimaginable peril to confront the ongoing anti-LGBTQ program raging in the repressive and closed Russian republic. Unfettered access and a remarkable approach to protecting anonymity exposes this under-reported atrocity–and an extraordinary group of people confronting evil.

constellations_primary.name: Welcome to Chechnya: tales through time
constellations_primary.description: Documentary Welcome to Chechnya used ground-breaking deep fake technology to hide the identities of LGBTQ+ people fleeing a government-orchestrated genocide in Chechnya.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tyler H. Walk, HBO Documentary Films, Public Square Films, David France & Joy A. Tomchin Film, Ninety Thousand Words, Maylo Films, BBC Storyville, Alice Henty, David France and Askold Kurov

results.title: The Rainmaker
results.creator_credit: Paramount, Constellation Entertainment, Michael Herr, Howard Cummings, Francis Ford Coppola, Steven Reuther, Fred Fuchs, Michael Douglas and Aggie Guerard Rodgers
results.brief_description: When Rudy Baylor, a young attorney with no clients, goes to work for a seedy ambulance chaser, he wants to help the parents of a terminally ill boy in their suit against an insurance company. But to take on corporate America, Rudy and a scrappy paralegal must open their own law firm.

constellations_other.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_other.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount, Constellation Entertainment, Michael Herr, Howard Cummings, Francis Ford Coppola, Steven Reuther, Fred Fuchs, Michael Douglas and Aggie Guerard Rodgers

results.title: The Night of the Hunter
results.creator_credit: James Agee, Charles Laughton, Paul Gregory, Paul Gregory Productions and United Artists
results.brief_description: In the Deep South, a serial-killing preacher hunts two young children who know the whereabouts of a stash of money.

results.title: The Death and Life of Marsha P. Johnson
results.creator_credit: Terasem Media & Films, Faliro House Productions, Race Point Films, James O'Donnell, Ninety Thousand Words, Public Square Films, David France and Mark Blane
results.brief_description: Describing herself as a ‘street queen,’ Johnson was a legendary fixture in New York City’s gay ghetto and a tireless voice for LGBT pride since the days of Stonewall, who along with fellow trans icon Sylvia Rivera, founded Street Transvestites Action Revolutionaries (S.T.A.R.), a trans activist group based in the heart of NYC’s Greenwich Village. Her death in 1992 was declared a suicide by the NYPD, but friends never accepted that version of events. Structured as a whodunit, with activist Victoria Cruz cast as detective and audience surrogate, The Death and Life of Marsha P. Johnson celebrates the lasting political legacy of Johnson, while seeking to finally solve the mystery of her unexplained death.

constellations_other.name: Welcome to Chechnya: tales through time
constellations_other.description: Documentary Welcome to Chechnya used ground-breaking deep fake technology to hide the identities of LGBTQ+ people fleeing a government-orchestrated genocide in Chechnya.

results.title: Stieg Larsson: The Man Who Played with Fire
results.creator_credit: B-Reel Films, Film i Väst, C More Entertainment, Generalissimo, Nordsvensk Filmunderhållning, TV4, Henrik Georgsson, Olof Berglind, Nathan Grossman and Metha Engqvist Griffiths
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Millennium Trilogy author Stieg Larsson and his pioneering work fighting right-wing extremists and neo-Nazis, an obsession with fatal consequences.

results.title: Rust and Bone
results.creator_credit: Virginie Montel, Jacques Audiard, Pascal Caucheteux, Martine Cassinelli, Why Not Productions, Les Films du Fleuve, France 2 Cinéma, Page 114, Lumière, Lunanime, Ciné+, Centre du Cinéma et de l'Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Vlaams Audiovisueel fonds, Région Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur, Département des Alpes-Maritimes, Casa Kafka Pictures Movie Tax Shelter Empowered by Dexia, Canal+, RTBF, France Télévisions, Michel Barthélémy, Thomas Bidegain, Craig Davidson and Alix Raynaud
results.brief_description: Put in charge of his young son, Ali leaves Belgium for Antibes to live with his sister and her husband as a family. Ali’s bond with Stephanie, a killer whale trainer, grows deeper after Stephanie suffers a horrible accident.
